intro: Pterostylis ophioglossa, commonly known as the snake orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to eastern Australia. It is characterized by its slender, upright stem and a single, lance-shaped leaf. The plant produces a single, downward-facing flower with a greenish-yellow lip and a distinctive, elongated spur. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and woodlands. The species is notable for its specialized pollination mechanism involving small flies.
